qas.question: What was Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi's profession?
Where does the word "algebra" come from?
What did Muslim mathematicians add to Arabic numerals?
What area of science did Al-Razi contribute to?

context: In mathematics, the Persian <a0_0>mathematician<a0_0/> Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi gave his name to the concept of the algorithm, while the term algebra is derived from <a1_0>al-jabr<a1_0/>, the beginning of the title of one of his publications. What is now known as Arabic numerals originally came from <a2_0>India<a2_0/>, but Muslim mathematicians did make several refinements to the number system, such as the introduction of <a3_0>decimal point notation<a3_0/>. Sabian mathematician Al-Battani (850-929) contributed to astronomy and mathematics, while Persian scholar Al-Razi contributed to <a4_0>chemistry and medicine<a4_0/>.
